newsitem.title: FRANCE: Total sees output above 1 mln bbls in 2005.
newsitem.headline: Total sees output above 1 mln bbls in 2005.

text.p: French energy group Total expects to boost output from the equivalent to 766,000 barrels per day in the first half of 1996 to as much as 1.25 million barrels by the year 2005, chairman Thierry Desmarest said on Wednesday.
"For 2005 a level of 1.25 million barrels is attainable," he told a news conference.
The group aims to increase production to between 950,000 and one million barrels per day by 2000 and to double production outside the Middle East over the next eight years.
Production outside the Middle East rose 28 percent in the first half to 478,000 barrels per day.

The group aims to shift the balance between the amount of oil produced and the amount refined, he said, adding that production volumes would overtake refining volumes in the year 2000, Desmarest said.
It aims to step up growth in its gas, electricity and chemicals activities and plans to launch new productivity drives for 1997-99, he said.
